camel.source.path.operation.name: camel.source.path.operation
camel.source.path.operation.description: Which operation to use One of: [events] [stats] [auth] [info] [ping] [version] [imagebuild] [imagecreate] [imageinspect] [imagelist] [imagepull] [imagepushimageremove] [imagesearch] [imagetag] [containerattach] [containercommit] [containercopyfile] [containercreate] [containerdiffinspectcontainer] [containerkill] [containerlist] [containerlog] [containerpause] [containerrestart] [containerremove] [containerstartcontainerstop] [containertop] [containerunpause] [containerwait] [execcreate] [execstart]

camel.source.endpoint.email.name: camel.source.endpoint.email
camel.source.endpoint.email.description: Email address associated with the user

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.cmdExecFactory.name: camel.source.endpoint.cmdExecFactory
camel.source.endpoint.cmdExecFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the DockerCmdExecFactory implementation to use

camel.source.endpoint.parameters.name: camel.source.endpoint.parameters
camel.source.endpoint.parameters.description: Additional configuration parameters as key/value pairs

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.certPath.name: camel.source.endpoint.certPath
camel.source.endpoint.certPath.description: Location containing the SSL certificate chain

camel.component.docker.configuration.name: camel.component.docker.configuration
camel.component.docker.configuration.description: To use the shared docker configuration

camel.component.docker.email.name: camel.component.docker.email
camel.component.docker.email.description: Email address associated with the user

camel.component.docker.bridgeErrorHandle.name: camel.component.docker.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.docker.bridgeErrorHandle.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.docker.basicPropertyBind.name: camel.component.docker.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.docker.basicPropertyBind.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.docker.cmdExecFactory.name: camel.component.docker.cmdExecFactory
camel.component.docker.cmdExecFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the DockerCmdExecFactory implementation to use

camel.component.docker.parameters.name: camel.component.docker.parameters
camel.component.docker.parameters.description: Additional configuration parameters as key/value pairs

camel.component.docker.certPath.name: camel.component.docker.certPath
camel.component.docker.certPath.description: Location containing the SSL certificate chain
